medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had upper respiratory infection symptoms for a week, followed by three days of vomiting and diarrhea, including one episode of bilious emesis. She experienced episodes of colicky abdominal pain after eating, particularly after consuming food like a hamburger, which improved spontaneously. Ongoing abdominal pain and fever were reported with a maximum temperature of 101.8Â°F.
